title: Two arrested in child's shooting death in Adams County
content:
ADAMS COUNTY, Ill. (WGEM) -
The Adams County Sheriff's Office said Saturday that two people linked to the death of a seven-year-old girl had been arrested.
The arrests came after Adams County Sheriff Deputies responded to Blessing Hospital Friday afternoon to investigate a seven-year-old girl with a reported gunshot wound.
Investigators found that the girl, Melina Torres, had suffered from an apparent gunshot wound and died as a result of her injury.
Adams County Coroner Jim Keller said Torres was pronounced dead at Blessing Hospital at 1:30 p.m. Friday.
Officers learned that the incident happened at Melina's grandmother's residence, southeast of Liberty, during a family gathering. Around 10:15 p.m., Officers arrested 32-year-old Daniel Roberts for endangering the life of a child, possession of weapon by a felon, and obstruction of justice. Officers also arrested 49-year-old Julie Roberts for obstruction of justice. Officer say Julie Roberts is the grandmother of Melina Torres, and Daniel Roberts is the girl's uncle.
"He shouldn't have had a rifle to begin with," Chief Deputy Joe Lohmeyer said. "It appears that they were doing some target practicing at the residence and a very tragic, preventable accident occurred."
Both were in Adams County Jail pending their court appearance on Monday.
Adams County States Attorney Jon Barnard says charges will be filed against four people for the incident, but did not say who they would be.
Adams County Sheriff Brian VonderHaar says the case is still under investigation.
Visitation for Melina Torres is Tuesday from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m.. Funeral services are set for Wednesday at 11:00 a.m. Both are at Duker and Haugh Funeral Home.
